data.name: Caterpie
data.flavorText: When attacked by bird Pokémon, it resists by releasing a terrifically strong odor from its antennae, but it often becomes their prey.

data.name: Alolan Exeggutor
data.flavorText: As it grew taller and taller, it outgrew its reliance on psychic powers, while within it awakened the power of the sleeping dragon.

data.name: Magmar
data.flavorText: When angered, it spouts brilliant fire from all over its body. It doesn't calm down until its opponent has burned to ash.

data.name: Alolan Sandshrew
data.flavorText: An ancient tradition of Alolan festivals, still carried on to this day, is a competition to slide Sandshrew across ice as far as one can.

data.name: Lapras
data.flavorText: These Pokémon were once near extinction due to poaching. Following protective regulations, there is now an overabundance of them.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: A plan was recently announced to gather many Pikachu and make an electric power plant.

data.name: Gastly
data.flavorText: Should a strange light be seen flickering in an abandoned building, Gastly is lurking there.

data.name: Mankey
data.flavorText: It can spontaneously become enraged. Everyone near it clears out as it rampages, and the resulting loneliness makes it angrier still.

data.name: Onix
data.flavorText: It usually lives underground. It searches for food while boring its way through the ground at 50 miles per hour.

data.name: Alolan Meowth
data.flavorText: When its delicate pride is wounded, or when the gold coin on its forehead is dirtied, it flies into a hysterical rage.

data.name: Alolan Dugtrio
data.flavorText: This Pokémon are cherished in the Alola region, where they are thought to be feminine deities of the land incarnate.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Current studies show it can evolve into an incredible eight different species of Pokémon.
